citeinfo.origin: University of Washington (UW), International Pacific Halibut Commission (IPHC)
citeinfo.title: The 1987 Bristol Bay Survey and the Bristol Bay Halibut Fishery, 1990 - 1992

descript.abstract: Bristol Bay is considered a nursery area for Pacific halibut and was closed to commercial halibut fishing from 1967 to 1989. In the summer of 1987 the International Pacific Halibut Commission (IPHC) conducted a survey in Bristol Bay to assess the commercial stock size of halibut and the incidence of sublegal fish. Three vessels fished the coastal area from Cape Newenham to Cape Seniavin. The catch per unit effort was 6 pounds, well below the catch per unit effort observed in other areas of the Bering Sea. The catch of sublegal halibut was low; less than 0.5 halibut per unit effort. The survey results suggested that a limited commercial fishery in Bristol Bay would not have an adverse impact on juvenile stocks. The IPHC extended the regulatory Area 4E boundary to allow commercial fishing in Bristol Bay in 1990. Fishing success has been poor compared to other areas and the number of vessels reporting landings in the fishery decreased from 97 in 1990 to 19 in 1992. Annual Bristol Bay catches have ranged from 14,000 to 26,000 pounds.
descript.purpose: To report the 1987 Bristol Bay survey and the Bristol Bay halibut fishery, 1990 - 1992

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: tester 2 fgdc 1972 USSR Sablefish Tagging Survey

descript.abstract: Alaska sablefish tagging data, consisting of release and recovery sizes and the length of time fish were at liberty, provide an independent estimate of growth rates. The vessel was named Ogon (Soviet).
descript.purpose: Primarily to provide resource assessment estimates to management.

citeinfo.origin: Republic of Korea, Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (MOMAF)
citeinfo.title: tester 2 Meteorological Data from Station Duckjeokdo, South Korea in China Real Time Data Base (RTDB) for NEAR-GOOS

abstract.p: Meteorological data collected from Station Duckjeokdo, South Korea.
Data can be downloaded from the China Real Time Data Base for NEAR-GOOS. First time users must register to gain database access.

descript.purpose: The National Marine Data and Information Service of China (NMDIS) has developed and maintained China Delayed Mode Data Base for NEAR-GOOS (CDMDB) to offer basic data service to NEAR-GOOS and GOOS communities.

idinfo.accconst: First time users must register to gain database access.
